recipe_card: Green Tea Kasutera (Green Tea Bread) 4 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"⅔ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4  eggs, separated"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons grapeseed oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons honey"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons milk"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons green tea powder (matcha)"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat oven to 320 degrees F (160 degrees C). Grease a small loaf pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat sugar and egg whites together in a bowl using an electric mixer until stiff peaks form. Add egg yolk and mix well. Stir grapeseed oil, honey, and milk into egg mixture."},{"recipe_directions":"Sift flour and green tea powder 2 times into a bowl; mix into egg mixture. Pour batter into prepared pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 50 minutes."}]

recipe_card: How to Make Rice Balls (Onigiri) 1 Rating
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"⅔ cup short-grain rice, rinsed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅔ cup water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 sheets nori (dry seaweed), cut into 1-inch strips"},{"recipe_ingredients":"salt to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"seasoned sesame seeds to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"shiso with hijiki (dried seaweed flakes) to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Combine rice and water in a heavy-bottomed pot with a tight-fitting lid. Soak for 20 to 30 minutes. Cover and bring to a boil over medium heat. Once water is boiling, reduce heat to low and cook until water is completely absorbed, 12 to 13 minutes. Remove from the heat; keep covered and steam for another 10 minutes. Remove lid and cool to room temperature, about 20 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Wet your hands and form small amounts of rice into triangle shapes if possible, or round balls. Wrap each onigiri with a strip of nori. Season with salt and garnish with sesame seeds and seaweed flakes."}]

recipe_card: Black Sesame Pudding 1 Rating
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"6 tablespoons water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons powdered unflavored gelatin"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ cups milk"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons black sesame paste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Stir water and gelatin together in a bowl until gelatin dissolves."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine milk, sugar, and black sesame paste in a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir until sugar melts, 2 to 4 minutes. Stir gelatin mixture into milk mixture; cook and stir pudding for 1 to 2 minutes. Remove from heat."},{"recipe_directions":"Chill pudding in the saucepan at room temperature for 5 minutes. Pour pudding into small bowls and refrigerate until chilled and set, about 2 hours."}]

recipe_card: Beef Kushiyaki 12 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2 ½ tablespoons mirin (Japanese sweet wine)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 clove garlic, minced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ cup soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅛ teaspoon monosodium glutamate (such as Aji-No-Moto®)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pound beef sirloin steak, cut paper-thin"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3  green onions, cut into 2-inch slices"},{"recipe_ingredients":"bamboo skewers"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"In a bowl, mix the mirin, garlic, soy sauce, monosodium glutamate, and sugar; stir to dissolve the sugar. Place the beef and green onions into the marinade, stir to coat with marinade, and allow to stand for 30 minutes. Soak bamboo skewers in water."},{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven's broiler and set the oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source."},{"recipe_directions":"Roll a slice of thin beef around a piece of green onion; skewer the roll with 2 bamboo skewers, place about 1/2 inch apart. Repeat twice more, placing 3 beef rolls onto the 2 skewers. Repeat with remaining beef, green onion, and skewers until all the beef is rolled up. Place skewers onto a broiling pan. Discard used marinade."},{"recipe_directions":"Broil until browned on both sides, about 3 to 3 1/2 minutes per side."}]

recipe_card: The Best Japanese Street Food Snacks, Appetizers, and Small Bites
recipe_name: The Best Japanese Street Food Snacks, Appetizers, and Small Bites

recipe_card: Tuna Tartare 19 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons olive oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon sesame seeds"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon wasabi powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅛ teaspoon cracked black pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pound sushi grade tuna, finely diced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"sliced French bread"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Combine olive oil, sesame seeds, wasabi, and black pepper in a bowl. Add tuna and toss until evenly coated. Adjust seasoning as desired with additional wasabi powder or black pepper. Serve on sliced French bread."}]

recipe_card: Vegetarian Nori Rolls 24 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups uncooked short-grain white rice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 ¼ cups water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons honey"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon minced garlic"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 ounces firm tofu, cut into 1/2 inch strips"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons rice vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 sheets nori seaweed sheets"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½  cucumber, julienned"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½  avocado, julienned"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 small carrot, julienned"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"In a large saucepan cover rice with water and let stand for 30 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"In a shallow dish combine soy sauce, honey, and garlic. In this mixture, marinate tofu for at least 30 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Bring water and rice to a boil and then reduce heat; simmer for about 20 minutes, or until thick and sticky. In a large glass bowl, combine cooked rice with rice vinegar."},{"recipe_directions":"Place a sheet of nori on a bamboo mat. Working with wet hands, spread 1/4 of rice evenly over nori; leave about 1/2 inch on the top edge of the nori. Place 2 strips of marinated tofu end to end about 1 inch from the bottom. Place 2 strips of cucumber next to tofu, then avocado and carrot."},{"recipe_directions":"Roll nori tightly from the bottom, using the mat to help make a tight roll. Seal by moistening the top 1/2 inch with water. Repeat with remaining ingredients. Slice with a serrated knife into 1-inch thick slices."}]

recipe_card: Yummylicious Japanese Beef Croquettes 39 Ratings
recipe_tags: [{"recipe_tags":"Appetizers and Snacks"},{"recipe_tags":"Meat and Poultry"},{"recipe_tags":"Meatball Appetizer Recipes"}]
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"3 medium russet potatoes, peeled and chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon butter"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon vegetable oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 onions, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ pound ground beef"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 teaspoons light soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"all-purpose flour for coating"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 large eggs, beaten"},{"recipe_ingredients":"panko bread crumbs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup oil for frying"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Add potatoes to a large pot of salted water and bring to a boil; cook until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain and pour potatoes into a large bowl. Stir in butter and mash with a fork or potato masher. Set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in onions and cook until soft. Stir in beef and soy sauce. Cook, stirring continuously, until beef is browned and all the liquid is evaporated. Combine beef and onions with potatoes, and stir well."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat 1/2 cup oil in a deep skillet or wok over medium-high heat."},{"recipe_directions":"Shape potato and beef mixture into 10 similarly sized balls, then flatten into patties. Dredge patties in flour, then dip in egg, and coat with panko bread crumbs. Carefully place patties into oil and fry until golden brown on each side."}]

recipe_card: Broiled Mochi with Nori Seaweed 11 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"8  frozen mochi squares"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup soy sauce, or to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 sheet nori (dry seaweed)"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (275 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Dip mochi into soy sauce, then place onto a baking sheet."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until heated through, about 5 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Meanwhile, cut nori into eight strips. Heat strips in a large skillet over medium heat until warm, 1 to 2 minutes. Remove from the heat."},{"recipe_directions":"Wrap a nori strip around each mochi. Serve warm."}]

recipe_card: Japanese Deviled Eggs 28 Ratings
recipe_tags: [{"recipe_tags":"Appetizers and Snacks"},{"recipe_tags":"Deviled Eggs"},{"recipe_tags":"Spicy Deviled Egg Recipes"}]
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"9 large eggs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons sesame seeds"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup mayonnaise"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons wasabi paste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons rice wine vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 tablespoons panko bread crumbs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons thinly sliced green onions"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Place eggs in a saucepan; cover with water. Bring to a boil, remove from heat, and let eggs stand in hot water for 15 minutes. Remove eggs from hot water, cool under cold running water, and peel."},{"recipe_directions":"Place sesame seeds in a dry skillet over medium heat; cook and stir until lightly browned, about 3 minutes. Remove to cool on a paper towel-lined plate."},{"recipe_directions":"Cut each egg in half lengthwise; place egg yolks into a food processor with mayonnaise, soy sauce, wasabi paste, and rice vinegar. Process until smooth; add bread crumbs and green onion to yolk mixture and pulse just enough to mix evenly."},{"recipe_directions":"Arrange egg white halves on a serving platter; spoon yolk mixture into whites. Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds."}]

recipe_card: Japanese Oyster Shooters 2 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup mirin (Japanese sweet wine)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons sake"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon rice wine vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon wasabi powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"12  fresh oysters"},{"recipe_ingredients":"6  quail eggs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ teaspoon tobiko (flying fish roe)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"6  lemon wedges"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Whisk together mirin, sake, soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, and wasabi powder in a bowl. Allow mixture to sit at room temperature until sediments sink to the bottom of the bowl, about 2 hours."},{"recipe_directions":"Shuck oysters; place 2 oysters in each shooter glass."},{"recipe_directions":"Ladle 2 tablespoons mirin mixture into each glass, without disturbing sediments at the bottom."},{"recipe_directions":"Crack 1 quail egg into each glass. Top each with 1/8 teaspoon tobiko and garnish with lemon wedges. Serve immediately."}]

recipe_card: Okonomiyaki 50 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup chopped cooked chicken"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ cups thinly sliced napa cabbage"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup shredded carrots"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3  green onions, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"12  fresh green beans, cut into 1/2 inch pieces"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 small green bell pepper, cut into thin strips"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 small zucchini, cut into thin strips"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 large eggs, lightly beaten"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup chicken stock"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vegetable oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon toasted sesame oil"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"In a large bowl, mix chicken, cabbage, carrots, green onions, green beans, green bell pepper, and zucchini. In a separate bowl, beat together eggs, flour, chicken stock, and soy sauce. Pour batter over chicken mixture and toss to thoroughly coat."},{"recipe_directions":"Mix vegetable oil and sesame oil in a skillet over medium heat. Scoop about 1/4 cup batter into skillet, enough to make a 2 1/2 inch circle. Cover and cook 4 minutes, or until the bottom is golden brown. Flip and continue cooking 4 minutes, or until cooked through. Drain on paper towels."}]

recipe_card: Tofu Hiyayakko 23 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon dashi granules"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ (12 ounce) package silken tofu"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ teaspoons grated fresh ginger root"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon thinly sliced green onion"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch bonito shavings (dry fish flakes)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch toasted sesame seeds"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Mix the soy sauce, sugar, dashi granules, and water together in small bowl until sugar dissolves. Place the tofu on a small plate and top with ginger, green onion, and bonito shavings. Drizzle the soy mixture on top, and sprinkle with sesame seeds."}]

recipe_card: Sweet Potato Tempura 5 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2 large eggs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup ice water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons ice water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups oil for frying"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large sweet potato, scrubbed and sliced into 1/8-inch slices"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup rice wine"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup soy sauce"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Make the tempura: Beat eggs in a large bowl until frothy. Stir in 3/4 cup plus 3 tablespoons ice water, 3/4 cup plus 1 tablespoon flour, and salt until just incorporated; batter should still be very lumpy."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Set a wire rack over several layers of paper towels."},{"recipe_directions":"Dry sweet potato slices with paper towels. Dip three slices into batter, letting excess batter drip back into the bowl. Fry in the preheated oil until golden brown, about 2 minutes per side. Use a slotted spoon to transfer sweet potatoes to the wire rack. Repeat to dip and fry remaining sweet potatoes."},{"recipe_directions":"Make the dipping sauce: Whisk rice wine and soy sauce together in a small bowl. Serve with tempura."}]

recipe_card: Cream Cheese and Crab Sushi Rolls 48 Ratings
recipe_name: Cream Cheese and Crab Sushi Rolls
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup uncooked white rice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons rice vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 sheets nori seaweed sheets"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼  cucumber, peeled and sliced lengthwise"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 pieces imitation crab legs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ (3 ounce) package cream cheese, sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon minced fresh ginger root"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Gather all ingredients."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Bring rice and water to a boil in a saucepan over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the rice is tender, and the liquid has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes. Stir in rice vinegar and salt. Allow to cool completely."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Lay out seaweed sheets. Moisten hands with water, then spread cooled rice evenly on each sheet, leaving a 1/2-inch gap along one edge, lengthwise. Arrange strips of cucumber, imitation crabmeat, and cream cheese on top of the rice in a straight line along the side opposite the gap. Roll up sushi from the toppings to the seaweed sheet's exposed end."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Using a sharp wet knife, slice each roll into 5 or 6 pieces. Serve with minced ginger on the side."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"}]

recipe_card: Japanese Tamago Egg 40 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"4  eggs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/4 cup prepared dashi stock"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon mirin (Japanese sweet wine)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/2 teaspoon soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/2 teaspoon vegetable oil, or more as needed"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Beat eggs thoroughly in a bowl; whisk in dashi stock, sugar, mirin, and soy sauce until sugar has dissolved."},{"recipe_directions":"Lightly grease a nonstick skillet and heat over medium heat."},{"recipe_directions":"Pour a thin layer of egg mixture into the hot pan and swirl to coat the pan. Cook until egg layer is firm on the bottom but still slightly liquid on top, about 1 minute. Then lift up one edge using a spatula and roll up the egg layer. Push omelet roll to one side of the skillet. Oil the skillet again and pour in another thin layer of egg, lifting the first omelet roll up slightly to allow the egg to flow underneath; roll up the first omelet in the new layer of egg and push omelet to the edge of the skillet as before. Repeat the process with the remaining egg mixture, oiling the pan each time if needed."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove rolled omelet to a serving platter and cut into 6 equal pieces to serve."}]
